reviews.review_msg: She's literally the worst prof in sfu. I took her class on last semester and her slides and quizzes are super unclear. Also, she's mean as hell. Especially, she never replies on student's email.

Amazon teachers and lectures. Much more fun to learn Japanese with her. Lovely and happy to answer any questions you had. 

As you all know, this is a language class, speaking matters, shows by oral test and group presentation. 

Be aware of weekly quizzes, group project, presentation. 

Sometimes participant extra activities such as ramen tour.

she's amazing, but japanese courses are really difficult. Don't take this class unless you're willing to put in a lot of time. Naoko is an amazing teacher though. Super funny, and really cares about her students!!!

Recently took an intersession with her, one of the more interesting and active courses I've taken in university thus far. Very kind and very approachable prof, you'll be in good hands. Pro tip: Look for resources outside of class like friends who speak Japanese, TV shows and music since it helps you immerse yourself in your study.
A very lovely and helpful professor. Very charismatic and funny.
She is extremely helpful, kind and funny. If you are going to take any Japanese course you have to take it with her!

One of the best instructors ever. She is more interested in how you progress and improve you Japanese. Extremely helpful and easy to get along with. Class is really easy as long as you put in some effort. The class average was 80%..

Awesome lecturer! He makes Japanese easy to understand and very enjoyable to learn. He only teaches at SFU campus though. I would definitely recommend students go take JAPN at Surrey just to be in his class.
very helpful instructor...
Very good instructor.  Plus, he's very outgoing and even makes time to make social gatherings for us so we can get to have fun with our Japanese skills.  Hope he teaches JAPN 200 in the fall!

The trend of instructors is to use a unpublished textbook written by an instructor at school. The PDF book is divided into grammar and lessons; lessons are seemingly random in content, focused on Canadian oriented vocabulary. Because of the sheer volume of vocabulary and disjointed content the lessons often resort to fill-in-the blank work.

Instruction time resorts to pushing students through fill-in-the-blank workbooks and partner oral work following strict guideline both of which discourages students to develop tangible skill. Instruction time all but ignores the grammar component which students are told to self-study outside of the class.
The textbook itself is laden typos and errors, and heavy in grammatically jargon ignoring the work of modern to simplify textbook formats such as those by Genki.

Finally the format of the class is set up to have students fail. Midterms are oral exams, while the final exam is 3 hours of written work with zero oral content, which leaves students ill prepared and forced to scramble to memorize hundreds of disjointed vocabulary rather than focus of strengthening skills.

She is extremely pick on marking and scares students to ask question that she mentioned in her syllabus.It seems she has a bad temper so that she sometimes yells at student. Worst professor I ever had..extremely hard to ask a question...what a ****

This is not an "easy" course, you have to study the materials that she WANTS you to study the way she WANTS. Although she tries to help students, she is really picky on little details (and I mean it) so it can get a little bit annoying. Overall I think it's an ok class as long as you are interested in Japanese, and willing to study at least some.

I can scarcely believe how ridiculous some comments below are. I've taken 3 yrs of Japanese in highschool & studied outside of it, & I'm just finishing JAPN101 now. I can tell you that Omae Sensei has been the most helpful, hilarious, & fun teacher I have ever had. She's neither strict nor mean & will help you immensely with Japanese! Take JAPN101!

Worst prof I ever had. I was very interested in learnig Japanese, but after I took her course I decided not to take any upper level Japanese courses anymore. Her textbook is also useless. I don't know why she continues to use that.
very nice prof.!  She is very friendly altho she might seem a little picky at times.  She teaches quite fast and expect you to keep up with her.

This is the kind of prof who'd receive a D at best from the evaluation of her students....extremely hard, picky, always late for class, asking those in-your-face questions....mmmm, & i wonder how u can pass the final when all u were told is to read the two non-refundable texts with no criteria given....anyways, avoid at all cost!!!!
Horrible teacher.
No Comments
No Comments

Omae is extremely picky about how you do every little line when writing Japanese. Her classes are dull, but if you get distracted, she will ask you leading questions, then try to convince you that you have ADD (ADHD). The final exam is difficult.
No Comments
No Comments
Omae is strict but quite nice if u know her more. Her expectation is high, easy to get grade but very demanding course. Worth to learn it.
Worst Japanese teacher I've ever had
Very nice and friendly...once you get to know her.
